channel.title: WSL on Jack Whiting
channel.description: Recent content in WSL on Jack Whiting

item.title: Setting Up A Windows 10 Development Environment with WSL, PHP & Laravel
item.description: Preface Recently, I’ve been toying around with the use of WSL (Windows Subsystem for Linux) for development. I’ve used a Mac for development work over better part of the last decade and required the Windows setup to mimic my workflow. Typically, I create Laravel applications along with the occasional WordPress site, using the following tools: Nginx PHP MySql Dnsmasq Valet After a bit of testing and reconfiguration, I managed to get WSL setup with the above in a few easy steps and I’m relatively happy with the workflow.
